summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection uses scanning systems to detect illegal drugs and other contraband at land crossings. CBP is deploying additional X-ray systems with a goal of scanning all vehicles crossing the border. However, CBP's deployment plans exclude 9 major crossings that account for nearly 40% of passenger vehicle traffic at the southwest border. In addition, CBP hasn't defined key performance measures it needs...
title: Land Port Inspections: CBP Should Improve Performance Data and Deployment Plans for Scanning Systems
